constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: MVKTC Name: Motor Vehicle Restricted Area (KTC)
KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
PROPST Name: P3b East of Eden Street, Ashdown Road, Eden Quarter

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
LBCASE LB Address: Friends Meeting House Eden StreetLB Grade: LOCALLB Ref: 383

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Dra 3DR 581 AR 9979 3 3D Visualisations 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9977 3 Caversham House grid line 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9975 3 Elevations in Context Caversham House 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9974 3 Elevation AA in context 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9971 3 Site sections 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9970 3 Elevations CC-DD in context 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9969 3 Elevations AA-BB in context 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9967 3 Section F-F 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9966 3 Section E-E 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9965 3 Roof plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9964 3 Section D-D 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9963 3 Section C-C 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9962 3 Section B-B 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9961 3 Section A-A 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9960 3 Elevations CC-DD 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9959 3 Elevations AA-BB 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9958 3 Fourth floor plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9955 3 Third floor plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9954 3 Second floor plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9953 3 First floor plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9952 3 Ground floor 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9951 3 Lower ground floor 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9903 3 Ground floor in context 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9901 3.1 Location plan 13/11/2012Dra 3DR 581 AR 9902 3.1 Proposed site plan 13/11/2012First Floor Window Graphics 09/07/2018Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The building shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development in accordance with the agreed materials and external finish approved under condition discharge 15/12095/COND.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The building shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development in accordance with the agreed design details relating to original condition 4 and 5, as approved under condition discharge 15/12095/COND.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No external lighting shall be installed within the service area without the priorwritten approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers inaccordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with the architectural lighting strategy to Eden Street approved under condition discharge 15/12095/COND.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

All ground floor windows on the Eden Street frontage shall be maintained as clear glazed, without obstruction, except as otherwise shown on the drawings hereby approved.Reason: In order to maintain the continuity and interest of the shopping frontage.

The secure cycle parking facilities for the staff of the development approved under condition discharge application 15/12095/COND, shall be fully provided and made available for use at all times and shall thereafter be permanently retained.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Deliveries to the site and servicing shall only take place between 7am and 8pm Mondays to Saturdays and between 10am and 4pm on Bank Holidays (with a maximum of 3 deliveries on any Bank Holiday). There shall be no deliveries or servicing on Sundays. Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Considerate deliveries practices are to be implemented at all times, in accordance with methodologies identified in the report by RPS of HGV Deliveries.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No flues or pipework, other than rainwater pipes, shall be fixed to the elevations other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved or in accordance with details which shall have first been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In the interests of the visual amenities of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved shall be installed without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties and the visual amenities of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The rating level of the noise determined by the cumulative sound emissions of the plant hereby permitted shall be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level at any given time of operation. The noise levels shall be determined 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade. Measurements and assessment shall be carried out in accordance withBS4142:1997.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Where emergency generation is installed and needs testing the Authority will permit the LAeq,T noise level from this plant to be no greater than 5dB above the existing background noise level when measured 1m externally to the nearest residential facade for the purpose of testing for up to 1 hour per month between 09-00 and 16-00 hours Monday to Friday only and not on apublic holiday.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be maintained in accordance with the agreed archaeological report and, findings and recommendations approved as part of condition discharge 15/12328/COND,15/12742/COND and 16/12753/COND.Further submission is required, including the final off-site report and post-excavation assessment.Reason: Important archaeological remains may exist on this site. Accordingly the planning authority wishes to secure the provision of archaeological excavation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development, in accordance with the guidance and model condition set out in PPG16 in accordance with Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Adopted April 2012.

The flood mitigation measures identified in the FRA prepared by Lees Roxbourgh shall be incorporated for the lifetime of the development and shall include the following measures: signing up to the Environment Agency Flood Warning service; to provide written management procedures on flood risk and evacuation for staff; and to provide safe escape routes for evacuation intimes of flood via the two protected lobbies to the rear yard.Reason: In the interests of Flood Risk Management, in accordance with Policy K24 of the K+20 Action Area Plan and Policy DM4 (Water Management and Flood Risk) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with the Green Travel Plan approved under condition discharge 15/13238/COND, which contains a package of measures for reducing the number of vehicle trips to the site by staff and visitors, shall be implemented upon the development being brought into first use, and in accordance with details to be submitted to, and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. The approved Travel Plan identifies an action plan with timescales for the implementation of the proposed measures, details of an ongoing programme of monitoring and review and targets for reductions in car use.Reason: To ensure that sustainable transport methods are encouraged and implemented in accordance with Policies CS5 (Reducing the Need to Travel) and CS6 (Sustainable Travel) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be maintained in accordance with the sustainability measures and BREEAM post construction review, as approved under condition discharge 15/12152/COND, 16/12960/COND and 18/12160/COND.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation as set out in Policies 5.2 (Minimising Carbon Dioxide Emissions) and 5.3 (Sustainable Design & Construction) of the London Plan (July 2011) and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

All windows in the rear elevation and situated on the third floor of the building hereby permitted, shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing of a patterned type only.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
description: Variation of Condition Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with Condition 11 (Hours of Deliveries) of Planning permission 12/12754/FUL which allowed for the  refurbishment and extension of Primark retail store (as varied by planning permission 18/12568/FUL (Condition 8).Condition currently  precludes deliveries on Bank Holidays. Variation sought to  allow deliveries on Bank Holidays between 10am and 4pm  (Amended description of development).
